questions.question: What is the recommended strategy for allocating/diversifying investment risks?
answers: Investing in both different loan originators and different types of LPN so that the total portfolio is divided into as many different instruments as possible. A well-diversified portfolio could be when an investor has invested in at least 20 different LPNs
Investing only in the one loan originator's instruments, as it is unlikely that this loan originator will have difficulty repaying its financial instruments
Investing in loan originators that are from a particular region, if that region seems more stable than others
